name: All About Andre (And Others) Quiz | Musicals | 10 Questions

questions.text: Gregory Jbara originated the role of the suave Frenchman Andre Thibault. Which is the first song he has lines in?
questions.explanation:
Give Them What They Want.

	Andre is Lawrence's right hand man. Conveniently, he's also the chief of police!

questions.text: Andre's solo song "Chimp in a Suit" refers to which other character?
questions.explanation:
Freddy Benson.

	Lawrence takes Freddy on as his protege, and Andre doesn't like that idea one bit! In the original Broadway cast, Freddy was played by Norbert Leo Butz.

questions.text: Muriel Eubanks finds romance with Andre. Where does Muriel say she is from?
questions.explanation:
Omaha.

	"I'm Muriel of Omaha," Muriel states as she dances with Andre. The role of Muriel was originally played by Joanna Gleason.

questions.text: Jolene gets engaged to Lawrence in Act One. Where are they to make their home?
questions.explanation:
Oklahoma.

	Jolene plans their future life out in the showstopping number "Oklahoma?" Sara Gettelfinger originally played Jolene.

questions.text: Which two performers won awards for their roles in "Dirty Rotten Scoundrels"?
questions.correct: Gregory Jbara and Norbert Leo Butz
options: John Lithgow and Norbert Leo Butz
Sherie Rene Scott and John Lithgow
questions.explanation:
Gregory Jbara and Norbert Leo Butz.

	Norbert won a Tony for Best Actor in a Musical and Gregory won a Best Featured Actor in a Musical from Broadwayworld.com. Everyone else was nominated for Tonys.

questions.text: What is Muriel's last sung line in the show?
questions.explanation:
"Like zis."

	"Like Zis/Like Zat" is sung by Muriel and Andre while they are dancing.

questions.text: Jolene Oakes has lines in two songs. What is the second one called?
questions.explanation:
All About Ruprecht.

	Jolene fits her two songs into less than a half hour onstage!

questions.text: What is the last song in which Andre has lines?
questions.explanation:
Like Zis (Reprise).

	It is only a few lines long, and was not included on the cast recording.

questions.text: What article of clothing does Muriel mention in her song "What Was A Woman to Do?"?
questions.explanation:
Shoes.

	"I wore these Ferragamo shoes." Muriel laments her fate in this song.

questions.text: In "Like Zis/Like Zat" what is the moon suspended like?
questions.explanation:
A bauble in the sky.

	Yes, it is actually "BAUBLE in the sky" and not "bubble in the sky". Gregory Jbara's accent is so good hardly anyone can tell the difference!
